posts.title: Antipasto
posts.author: Rustin C
posts.content: Pasto means meal and ante is Latin for “before”, so antipasto means appetisers. These can be sliced salami, grilled vegetables, pickled olives and other smallgoods. Crusty ciabatta-style bread is a compulsory accompaniment.

posts.title: Fettuccine Al Ragu
posts.author: Rustin C
posts.content: Visit the northern city of Bologna looking for spaghetti bolognese and you’re in for a surprise. There, they call meat sauce ragu and it’s served with flat, ribbon noodles called fettuccine. A great ragu has a base of diced celery, carrot and onion, and contains good-quality meat.

posts.title: Minestrone
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: Italian soups are usually made with beans or barley, a good stock and various vegetables. Minestrone means “big soup” and is made with a base of onions, celery, carrots, potatoes and tomatoes, simmered in stock. Diced bacon or pancetta, cooked red kidney beans and pasta shells are often added.

posts.title: Sugo Alla Napoletana
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: The best Italian tomatoes are said to grow near the city of Naples, and the classic Italian tomato sauce, called napoletana sauce, originated from this region. It contains tomatoes, freshly chopped basil, and onions or garlic (or both). Some cooks also add stock, celery, carrots and red wine or vinegar.

posts.title: Gnocchi
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: These little dumplings are made with potatoes that are cooked until soft, then mixed with a touch of flour. Some people like to add an egg yolk to their gnocchi dough or use ricotta instead of potatoes.
posts.extra: These little dumplings are made with potatoes that are cooked until soft, then mixed with a touch of flour. Some people like to add an egg yolk to their gnocchi dough or use ricotta instead of potatoes. Cook the dumplings until they bob to the surface of the boiling water.

posts.title: Risotto
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: Making a good risotto is an art. Start by softening your vegies (onions, garlic, mushrooms, zucchini, asparagus) in butter or oil, then add the uncooked rice grains and simmer.
posts.extra: Making a good risotto is an art. Start by softening your vegies (onions, garlic, mushrooms, zucchini, asparagus) in butter or oil, then add the uncooked rice grains and simmer. Gradually add boiling hot stock, one ladleful at a time, and stir to release the rice starch. The more you stir, the creamier your risotto.

posts.title: Polenta
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: A pale yellow or white cornmeal, polenta is cooked in boiling water and stirred until tender. You can eat it as a porridge-like accompaniment to pasta sauces and meats, or allow it to set, then slice and grill to make simple cornbread.

posts.title: Pizza
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: Naples lays claim to la vera pizza – the true  pizza. Their version is fluffy with a slightly raised crust. The Romans, on the other hand, make their pizza thin, flat and toasty.
posts.extra: Naples lays claim to la vera pizza – the true  pizza. Their version is fluffy with a slightly raised crust. The Romans, on the other hand, make their pizza thin, flat and toasty. Italians are very strict about not piling on too many toppings. The classic Italian pizza is the Margherita, simply topped with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella and basil leaves.

posts.title: TIRAMISU Tiramisu
posts.author: Rustin Cassiem
posts.content: This favourite Italian dessert is easy to prepare. Simply soak sponge finger biscuits (savoiardi) in a bowl of strong espresso coffee – add a little liqueur if you like.
posts.extra: This favourite Italian dessert is easy to prepare. Simply soak sponge finger biscuits (savoiardi) in a bowl of strong espresso coffee – add a little liqueur if you like. Beat together some mascarpone, egg yolks and sugar, then fold in whisked egg whites. Layer the biscuits with the filling and you’re done. Tiramisu recipes.
